body_html:
I suggest find the requirements / dependencies -
Then create a Gemfile

source 'https://rubygems.org'
ruby "2.2.3"

then you can use RVM + bundler to lock into specific version requirements.

curl -sSL https://get.rvm.io | bash    
rvm install ruby-2.2.3   
gem install rvm  (restart terminal)      
gem install bundler  
bundle install  
bundle exec make

I suggest find the requirements / dependencies -
Then create a Gemfile
source 'https://rubygems.org'
ruby "2.2.3"

then you can use RVM + bundler to lock into specific version requirements.
curl -sSL https://get.rvm.io | bash    
rvm install ruby-2.2.3   
gem install rvm  (restart terminal)      
gem install bundler  
bundle install  
bundle exec make
body:
I suggest find the requirements / dependencies -
Then create a Gemfile

```
source 'https://rubygems.org'
ruby "2.2.3"
```

then you can use RVM + bundler to lock into specific version requirements.

```
curl -sSL https://get.rvm.io | bash    
rvm install ruby-2.2.3   
gem install rvm  (restart terminal)      
gem install bundler  
bundle install  
bundle exec make
```
